snippet: The strikes hit a camp where officials said fighters with the Shabab militant group were preparing an attack against American troops and their allies.
abstract: American airstrike on Shabab camp in Somalia kills about 150 militants who had gathered for an apparent graduation ceremony; officials say group, which has reemerged as major threat in region, was actively preparing for an attack.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jeffrey Gettleman from Lubumbashi, Democratic Republic of Congo; Michael D. Shear and Eric Schmitt from Washington; and Mohamed Ibrahim from Mogadishu, Somalia.

lead_paragraph: The strikes hit a camp where officials said fighters with the Shabab militant group were preparing an attack against American troops and their allies.

headline.main: U.S. Strikes in Somalia Kill 150 Shabab Fighters
headline.print_headline: U.S. Airstrikes at Somali Site Kill About 150

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
